clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of Deoxycoformycin(DCF)/Pentostatin In Lymphoid Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Deoxycoformycin (DCF) in Lymphoid Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the side effects and antitumor response of patients with lymphoid malignancies to Deoxycoformycin (DCF)/Pentostatin.

detailed_description.textblock: Deoxycoformycin(DCF)/Pentostatin is a T-cell cytotoxic drug with previously reported responses in lymphoid malignancies but larger studies are needed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Overall Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and approximately every 3 weeks thereafter
primary_outcome.description: Overall responses (OR) of participants with lymphoid malignancies to Deoxycoformycin (DCF)/Pentostatin defined as Complete Response (CR) and Partial Response (PR).

intervention.description: Patients received Deoxycoformycin (DCF)/Pentostatin administered by intravenous bolus daily over a consecutive 3-day period. This course was repeated at 3-week intervals.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic proof of lymphoid malignancy with an expected complete response rate of less than 20 percent OR have failed at least one prior therapy.
- No chemotherapy within 3 weeks of entry into study and must have recovered from acute toxic effects of prior therapy.
- Life expectancy of at least 12 weeks.
- Performance status equal to or less than Zubrod 2.
- Signed informed consent.
- Patients with measurable disease.
- Age at least 16 years.
- Adequate bone marrow function (unless involvement of bone marrow by lymphoma) defined as AGC greater than 1500 and platelet count greater than 100,000.
- Adequate hepatic function with a bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 mg % and SGPT less than or equal to 4 times the upper limits of normal.
- Adequate renal function defined as serum creatine less than or equal to 1.5 mg %.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No serious intercurrent illness.
- Adequate contraception (if applicable).
- NO patients with significant cardiac disease, i.e. New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III or IV.
- NO experimental clinical trial within 3 weeks of study entry.
- NO patients with active CNS disease.
- Full recovery from any prior surgical treatment.
- NO active active infections.
